name: Adobe Sign
description: The future of business is digital. Adobe Esign helps businesses of all sizes easily and securely sign, send, and manage documents in the cloud, with unmatched availability and legal enforceability.

configuration.name: API User
configuration.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

configuration.name: OAuth Scope
configuration.defaultValue: agreement_read:account agreement_send:account agreement_write:account library_read:account library_write:account user_login:account user_read:account user_write:account widget_read:account widget_write:account workflow_read:account workflow_write:account

configuration.name: API Domain
configuration.description: Domain for the API Base URL

configuration.name: Allow Select Fields parameter
configuration.description: Enables use of global fields query parameter to filter response to only specified fields. This will override any existing vendor functionality on the connector

configuration.name: OAuth Token Refresh URL
configuration.description: Adobe ESign OAuth Token Refresh URL

configuration.name: Filter null values from the response
configuration.description: Used to enable/disable filtering of null values from the responses.

configuration.name: Default select fields
configuration.description: Generic map used to specify default fields for bulk download and GET /all requests. Each key should be the canonical objectName and values may be specified as a comma-delimited string or a list of strings

configuration.name: Event poller refresh interval
configuration.description: Set time interval for polling application (in minutes)

configuration.name: Event Poller Resources Configuration
configuration.description: Event Poller Resources Configuration. The configuration is defined via JSON, an example of which is as follows - { "contacts": { "url": "/hubs/helpdesk/contacts", “idField”: “user.id”, “datesConfiguration”: { "updatedDateField": "user.updated_at", "updatedDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX", “createdDateField”: “user.created_at”, “createdDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX" }, "pageSize": 10000 } }

resources.description: Create a search object for agreement asset event . It will return the result for the first page and search Id to fetch results for further pages

parameters.name: apiUser
parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

parameters.name: nextPage
parameters.description: Cursor Id

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Page size

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Enter the start and end date values

events.description: An ordered list of the events in the audit trail of this document

nextPageCursor.description: The page cursor of the next page to be fetched. If the next page cursor is blank then the given page is the last page

DocumemtEventForUser.description: An ordered list of the events in the audit trail of this document

agreementAssetId.description: The ID of the agreement asset

agreementAssetName.description: The name of the agreement asset

agreementAssetType.description: The type of the agreement asset

documentHistoryEvent.description: An ordered list of the events in the audit trail of this document
An ordered list of the events in the audit trail of this document

actingUserEmail.description: Email address of the user that initiated the event

actingUserIpAddress.description: The IP address of the user that initiated the event

comment.description: The event comment. For RECALLED or REJECTED, the reason given by the user that initiates the event. For DELEGATE or SHARE, the message from the acting user to the participant

date.description: The date of the audit event

description.description: A description of the audit event

deviceLocation.description: Location of the device that created the event (This value may be null due to limited privileges)

participantEmail.description: Email address of the user that initiated the event

synchronizationId.description: A unique identifier linking offline events to synchronization events (specified for offline signing events and synchronization events, else null)

vaultEventId.description: The identifier assigned by the vault provider for the vault event (if vaulted, otherwise null)

versionId.description: An ID which uniquely identifies the version of the document associated with this audit event

resources.description: Retrieves agreements for the user

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page

parameters.name: nextPage
parameters.description: The page number of resources to retrieve

parameters.name: apiUser
parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

displayUserSetInfosAgreements.description: The most relevant current user set for the agreement.It is typically the next signer if the agreement is from the current user,or the sender if received from another user

displayUserSetName.description: The name of the display userset.Returned only,if the API caller is the sender of agreement.

displayUserSetMemberInfosAgrGet.description: Displays the info about user set

company.description: Displays the name of the company of the user,if available

email.description: Displays the email of the user

fullName.description: Displays the full name of the user,if available.

agreementListObject.description: An array of User Agreement items

agreementId.description: The unique identifier of the agreement

esign.description: True if this is an e-sign document

latestVersionId.description: Aversion ID which uniquely identifies the current version of the agreement

status.description: The current status of the document from the perspective of the user

resources.description: Creates agreements for the user

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Agreement Data

parameters.name: apiUser
parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

agreementId.description: The unique identifier that can be used to query status and download signed documents

embeddedCode.description: Javascript snippet suitable for an embedded page taking a user to a URL

expiration.description: Expiration date for autologin. This is based on the user setting, API_AUTO_LOGIN_LIFETIME

url.description: Standalone URL to direct end users to

anyOrAll.description: It indicates if any one of the conditions or all of them have to be true.

backgroundColor.description: Background color of the form field in RGB or HEX formaT

borderColor.description: Color of the border of the field in RGB or HEX format

borderStyle.description: Style of the border of the field

borderWidth.description: Width of the border of the field in pixels

calculatedExpression.description: Expression to calculate value of the form field

conditions.description: Conditions to be evaluated which decides the visibility of the form field in association with showOrHide property

contentType.description: Content Type of the form field.

defaultValue.description: Default value of the form field

displayFormat.description: Format of the value of the field to be displayed based on the displayFormatType property

displayFormatType.description: Format type of the text field.

displayLabel.description: Display label attached to the field

fontColor.description: Font color of the form field in RGB or HEX format

fontName.description: Font name of the form field

fontSize.description: Font size of the form field in points

formatData.description: The format of data in text field

hidden.description: true if the field is hidden, else false

hiddenOptions.description: Text values which are hidden in a drop down form field

inputType.description: Input type of the form field

locations.description: All locations in a document where the form field is placed

masked.description: true if the input entered by the signer has to be masked (like password), else false

maskingText.description: Text to mask the masked form field

maxLength.description: Maximum length of the input text field in terms of no. of characters

maxNumberValue.description: Upper bound of the number that can be entered by the signer

minLength.description: Minimum length of the input text field in terms of no. of characters

minNumberValue.description: Lower bound of the number that can be entered by the signer

name.description: The name of the form field

radioCheckType.description: The type of radio button (if field is radio button, identified by inputType).

readOnly.description: true if it is a read-only field, else false

recipientIndex.description: Index of recipient, starting from 1, in recipients list passed in the request

regularExpression.description: Regular expression validation of the form field

required.description: true if it is a mandatory field to be filled by the signer, else false

showOrHide.description: Action to show/hide the form field is to be taken on the basis of evaluation of conditions

specialErrMsg.description: Error message to be shown to the signer if filled value doesn't match the validations of the form field

specialFormula.description: Formula used to calculate the value of the form field

tooltip.description: Text that appears while hovering over the field

visibleOptions.description: Text values which are visible in a drop down form field

authoringRequested.description: Indicates that authoring is requested prior to sending the document

autoLoginUser.description: If user settings allow, automatically logs the user in

locale.description: The locale in which page returned by this API should be shown in - for example, en_US or fr_FR. In case locale provided by client is not available or no locale is specified, page will be shown in the default language set in the user account

noChrome.description: Turn off Chrome for the URL generated

sendThroughWeb.description: A url to send page will be returned from where the agreement creation needs to be completed. All the parameters provided here will be retained in the send page

sendThroughWebOptions.description: A JSON object of Type SendThroughWebOptions to customize the sendPage. This one will apply only if sendThroughWeb is set to true

defaultValue.description: The default value of the field

redirectDelay.description: The delay (in seconds) before the user is taken to the success page. If this value is greater than 0, the user will first see the standard Adobe Sign success message, and then after a delay will be redirected to your success page.

redirectUrl.description: A publicly accessible url to which the user will be sent after successfully completing the signing process

email.description: Email of the recipient. This is required if fax is not provided. Both fax and email can not be provided
email.x-conditionally-required-description: This is required if fax is not provided. Both fax and email can not be provided

fax.description: Fax of the recipient. In case of recipient set having more than one member, fax is not allowed
fax.x-conditionally-required-description: This is required if email is not provided. Both fax and email can not be provided. In case of recipient set having more than one member, fax is not allowed

securityOptions.description: Security options that apply to the recipient

documentCreationInfoAgreements.description: Information about the document you want to send

callbackInfo.description: A publicly accessible url to which Adobe Sign will do an HTTP GET operation every time there is a new agreement event. HTTP authentication is supported using standard embedded syntax - i.e http://username:password@your.server.com/path/to/file. Adobe Sign can also ping your system using HTTP PUT with the final signed PDF. Please contact support@echosign.com if you wish to use this option

ccs.description: A list of one or more email addresses that you want to copy on this transaction. The email addresses will each receive an email at the beginning of the transaction and also when the final document is signed. The email addresses will also receive a copy of the document, attached as a PDF file

daysUntilSigningDeadline.description: The number of days that remain before the document expires. You cannot sign the document after it expires

fileInfos.description: A list of one or more files (or references to files) that will be sent out for signature. If more than one file is provided, they will be combined into one PDF before being sent out. Note: Only one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified

formFieldLayerTemplates.description: Specifies the form field layer template or source of form fields to apply on the files in this transaction. If specified, the FileInfo for this parameter must refer to a form field layer template via libraryDocumentId or libraryDocumentName, or if specified via transientDocumentId or documentURL, it must be of a supported file type. Note: Only one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified

formFields.description: Information of form fields of an agreement. PDF_SIGNATURE inputType field is currently not supported

locale.description: The locale associated with this agreement - specifies the language for the signing page and emails, for example fr_FR.

mergeFieldInfo.description: The values will be presented to the signers for editable fields; for read-only fields the provided values will not be editable during the signing process. Merging data into fields is currently not supported when used with libraryDocumentId or libraryDocumentName. Only file and url are currently supported

message.description: An optional message to the recipients, describing what is being sent or why their signature is required

name.description: The name of the agreement that will be used to identify it, in emails and on the website

postSignOptions.description: URL and associated properties for the success page the user will be taken to after completing the signing process

recipientSetInfos.description: A list of one or more recipient sets. A recipient set may have one or more recipients. If any member of the recipient set signs, the agreement is considered signed by the recipient set. For regular (non-MegaSign) documents, there is no limit on the number of electronic signatures in a single document. Written signatures are limited to four per document. This limit includes the sender if the signature of the sender is also required
recipientSetInfos.x-conditionally-required-dsecription: If signatureFlow is set to SENDER_SIGNS_ONLY, this parameter is optional

reminderFrequency.description: Optional parameter that sets how often you want to send reminders to the recipients. The possible values are DAILY_UNTIL_SIGNED or WEEKLY_UNTIL_SIGNED

securityOptions.description: Sets optional secondary security parameters for your document

signatureFlow.description: Selects the workflow you would like to use - whether the sender needs to sign only, before the recipient, after the recipient, or not at all. The possible values for this variable are SENDER_SIGNATURE_NOT_REQUIRED, SENDER_SIGNS_LAST, SENDER_SIGNS_FIRST, SEQUENTIAL, PARALLEL or SENDER_SIGNS_ONLY. Note: leave unspecified for hybrid routing
signatureFlow.x-conditionally-required-description: Selects the workflow you would like to use.Leave unspecified for hybrid routing

signatureType.description: Specifies the type of signature you would like to request - written or e-signature

vaultingInfo.description: Sets the vaulting properties that allows Adobe Sign to securely store documents with a vault provider

fileUploadOptionsPostAgr.description: Controls various file upload options available on the send page

libraryDocument.description: Whether library documents link should appear or not

localFile.description: Whether local file upload button should appear or not. Default value is taken as true

webConnectors.description: Whether link to attach documents from web sources like Dropbox should appear or not.

countryCode.x-conditionally-required-description: Required for the recipient to view and sign the document if authentication type is PHONE

phone.description: The phone number required for the recipient to view and sign the document if authentication type is PHONE

documentCreationInfo.description: Information about the document you want to send

options.description: Options for authorising and sending the agreement

mimeType.description: The mime type of the referenced file, used to determine if the file can be accepted and the necessary conversion steps can be performed
mimeType.x-conditionally-required-description: Applicable only when the parent property documentURL is given as a standalone field in FileInfo. Also required when name field does not have the file type attached.

name.description: The original system file name of the document being sent - used to name attachments, and to infer the mime type if one is not explicitly specified
name.x-conditionally-required-description: Applicable only when the parent property documentURL is given as a standalone field in FileInfo.

url.description: A publicly accessible URL for retrieving the raw file content. HTTP authentication is supported using standard embedded syntax - i.e. http://username:password@your.server.com/path/to/file
url.x-conditionally-required-description: Applicable only when the parent property documentURL is given as a standalone field in FileInfo.

value.description: Value to compare the value of the whenField with, to evaluate the condition

whenFieldLocationIndex.description: Index of the location of the whenField whose value is the basis of the condition

whenFieldName.description: Name of the field whose value is the basis of condition

authenticationMethod.description: The authentication method for the recipients to have access to view and sign the document

password.description: The password required for the recipient to view and sign the document

phoneInfos.description: The phoneInfo required for the recipient to view and sign the document

sendThroughWebOptionsPostAgr.description: A JSON object of Type SendThroughWebOptions to customize the sendPage. This one will apply only if sendThroughWeb is set to true

fileUploadOptions.description: Controls various file upload options available on the send page

height.description: Height of the form field in pixels

left.description: No. of pixels from left of the page for form field placement

pageNumber.description: Number of the page where form field has to be placed, starting from 1

top.description: No. of pixels from bottom of the page for form field placement

width.description: Width of the form field in pixels

externalPassword.description: The secondary password that will be used to protect signing the document for external signers. Note that Adobe Sign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties. This password is applied only if password protection is specified for external signers or all signers

internalPassword.description: The secondary password that will be used to protect signing the document for internal signers. Note that Adobe Sign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties. This password is applied only if password protection is specified for internal signers or all signers

kbaProtection.description: Signers need to pass Knowledge Based Authentication before they gain access to view and sign the document

openPassword.description: The secondary password that will be used to secure the PDF document. Note that Adobe Sign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties. This password is used only if protectOpen field is set to true

passwordProtection.description: Specifies if signers are required to enter a password to have access to sign the document

protectOpen.description: If set to true, the document is always be encrypted with this password every time it is sent by email. Recipients need to provide the password to be able to view the PDF files

webIdentityProtection.description: Specifies if signers are required to provide their web identity, before they gain access to view and sign the document

enabled.description: For accounts set up for document vaulting and the option to enable per agreement, this determines whether the document is to be vaulted

documentURL.description: File at a public URL location
documentURL.x-conditionally-required-description: Atleast one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified.The conditionally required is applicable to only fileInfos and not for the formFieldLayerTemplates.

libraryDocumentId.description: The ID for a library document that is available to the sender
libraryDocumentId.x-conditionally-required-description: Atleast one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified.The conditionally required is applicable to only fileInfos and not for the formFieldLayerTemplates.

libraryDocumentName.description: The name of a library document that is available to the sender
libraryDocumentName.x-conditionally-required-description: Atleast one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified.The conditionally required is applicable to only fileInfos and not for the formFieldLayerTemplates.

transientDocumentId.description: The documentID as returned from the transient document creation API
transientDocumentId.x-conditionally-required-description: Atleast one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified.The conditionally required is applicable to only fileInfos and not for the formFieldLayerTemplates.

privateMessage.description: Private message for the recipients in the set

recipientSetMemberInfos.description: Information about the members of the recipient set

recipientSetName.description: Specify the name of Recipient set. Maximum no of characters in recipient set name is restricted to 255

recipientSetRole.description:
Specify the role of recipient set. The possible values are 
        SIGNER (enum): Recipients marked as signers need to sign the document. They may be required to enter data into fields.
        APPROVER (enum): Recipients marked as approvers review and approve the document but they are not required to sign it. They may be required to enter data into fields.
        ACCEPTOR (enum): Recipients marked as acceptors are required to accept the document. They may be required to enter data into fields.
        FORM_FILLER (enum): Recipients marked as form fillers are required to enter data into the form fields and submit the document.
        CERTIFIED_RECIPIENT (enum): Recipients marked as certified recipient are required to view and acknowledge the receipt of the document.
        Delegators: Recipients marked as delegators may review the document but can?t sign, approve, accept or acknowledge it. They need to forward the document to another user who may take the appropriate action

securityOptions.description: Security options that apply to the recipient

signingOrder.description: Index indicating sequential signing group (specify for hybrid routing)

resources.description: Deletes an agreement. Agreement will no longer be visible in the user's Manage Page

parameters.description: Agreement Id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Agreement Id

DeviceLocation.description: Location of the device that created the event (This value may be null due to limited privileges)

nextParticipantSetInfos.description: Information about who needs to act next for this document

nextParticipantSetMemberInfos.description: Information about the members of the next participant set

nextParticipantSetName.description: The name of the next participant set. Returned only, if the API caller is the sender of agreement

nextParticipantSetMemberInfos.description: Information about all the participant sets of this document

email.description: The email address of the next participant

name.description: The name of the next participant, if available

waitingSince.description: The date since which the document has been waiting for the participant to take action

participantSetMemberInfosAgreement.description: Information about all the participant sets of this document

alternateParticipants.description: All the child participants of the current participant. The possible values for the status of these participants are, SHARE and DELEGATE

company.description: The company of the participant, if available

email.description: The email address of the participant

name.description: The name of the participant, if available

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant

securityOptions.description: Security options that apply to the participant

title.description: The title of the participant, if available

agreementId.description: A resource identifier that can be used to uniquely identify the agreement resource in other apis

events.description: An ordered list of the events in the audit trail of this document

expiration.description:
The date after 
which the document can no longer be signed, if an expiration date is 
configured. The value is nil if an expiration date is not set for the 
document

externalId.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried

latestVersionId.description: An ID which uniquely identifies the current version of the document

locale.description: The locale associated with this agreement - for example, en_US

message.description: The message associated with the document that the sender has provided

modifiable.description: Information about whether the agreement can be modified

name.description: The name of the document, specified by the sender

nextParticipantSetInfos.description:
Information about 
who needs to act next for this document - for example, if the agreement 
is in status OUT_FOR_SIGNATURE or OUT_FOR_APPROVAL, this will be the 
next signer or approver. If the AgreementStatus is a terminal state, 
this array is empty

participantSetInfos.description: Information about all the participant sets of this document

securityOptions.description: Security information about the document that specifies whether or not a password is required to view and sign the document

signatureType.description:
'ESIGN : Agreement needs to be signed electronically 
' or 'WRITTEN : Agreement will be signed using handwritten signature and signed document will be uploaded into the system 
']: Specifies the type of signature you would like to request - written or e-signature. The possible values are ESIGN or WRITTEN

status.description: The current status of the document

vaultingEnabled.description: Whether vaulting was enabled for the agreement

externalId.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried

group.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried

id.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried

namespace.description: Only supported value for the ExternalID namespace at this time is API_OTHER

DocumentHistoryEventsAgreements.description: An ordered list of the events in the audit trail of this document

actingUserEmail.description: Email address of the user that initiated the event

actingUserIpAddress.description: The IP address of the user that initiated the event

comment.description:
The event comment. 
For RECALLED or REJECTED, the reason given by the user that initiates 
the event. For DELEGATE or SHARE, the message from the acting user to 
the participant

date.description: The date of the audit event

description.description: A description of the audit event

deviceLocation.description: Location of the device that created the event (This value may be null due to limited privileges)

participantEmail.description: Email address of the user that initiated the event

synchronizationId.description:
A unique identifier
 linking offline events to synchronization events (specified for offline
 signing events and synchronization events, else null

vaultEventId.description: The identifier assigned by the vault provider for the vault event (if vaulted, otherwise null)

versionId.description: An ID which uniquely identifies the version of the document associated with this audit event

participantSetInfosAgreements.description: Information about all the participant sets of this document

participantSetId.description: The unique identifier of the participant set

participantSetMemberInfos.description: Information about the members of the recipient set

participantSetName.description: The name of the participant set. Returned only, if the API caller is the sender of agreement

privateMessage.description: Private message for the participants in the set

roles.description: The current roles of the participant set. A participant set can have one or more roles

securityOptions.description: Security options that apply to the participant

signingOrder.description: Index indicating sequential signing group (specified for hybrid routing)

status.description: The status of the participant set with respect to the document

resources.description: Cancels an agreement.

parameters.description: Agreement Data

parameters.description: The agreement identifier, as returned by the agreement creation API or retrieved from the API to fetch agreements

parameters.name: apiUser
parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

result.description: A status value showing the result of this operation

comment.description: An optional comment describing to the recipient why you want to cancel the transaction.
comment.x-conditional-required: Mandatory if the caller is a signer

notifySigner.description: Whether or not you would like the recipient to be notified that the transaction has been canceled.
notifySigner.x-conditional-required: Mandatory if any party has already signed this document

value.description: The state to which the agreement is to be updated. The only valid state for this variable is currently CANCEL

displayUserSetMemberInfosEnvelopes.description: Displays the info about user set

company.description: Displays the name of the company of the user, if available

email.description: Displays the email of the user

fullName.description: Displays the full name of the user, if available.

displayUserSetInfosEnvelopes.description: The most relevant current user set for the agreement. It is typically the next signer if the agreement is from the current user, or the sender if received from another user

displayUserSetName.description: The name of the display user set. Returned only, if the API caller is the sender of agreement.

agreementId.description: The unique identifier of the agreement

esign.description: True if this is an e-sign document

latestVersionId.description: A version ID which uniquely identifies the current version of the agreement

status.description: The current status of the document from the perspective of the user

authoringRequested.description: Indicates that authoring is requested prior to sending the document

privateMessage.description: Private message for the recipients in the set

recipientSetMemberInfos.description: Information about the members of the recipient set

recipientSetName.description: Specify the name of Recipient set. Maximum no of characters in recipient set name is restricted to 255

recipientSetRole.description:
Specify the role of recipient set. The possible values are 
 SIGNER (enum): Recipients marked as signers need to sign the document. They may be required to enter data into fields.
 APPROVER (enum): Recipients marked as approvers review and approve the document but they are not required to sign it. They may be required to enter data into fields.
 ACCEPTOR (enum): Recipients marked as acceptors are required to accept the document. They may be required to enter data into fields.
 FORM_FILLER (enum): Recipients marked as form fillers are required to enter data into the form fields and submit the document.
 CERTIFIED_RECIPIENT (enum): Recipients marked as certified recipient are required to view and acknowledge the receipt of the document.
 Delegators: Recipients marked as delegators may review the document but can?t sign, approve, accept or acknowledge it. They need to forward the document to another user who may take the appropriate action

securityOptions.description: Security options that apply to the recipient

signingOrder.description: Index indicating sequential signing group (specify for hybrid routing)

countryCode.x-conditionally-required-description: Required for the recipient to view and sign the document if authentication type is PHONE

phone.description: The phone number required for the recipient to view and sign the document if authentication type is PHONE

documentURL.description: File at a public URL location

libraryDocumentId.description: The ID for a library document that is available to the sender

libraryDocumentName.description: The name of a library document that is available to the sender

transientDocumentId.description: The documentID as returned from the transient document creation API

email.description: Email of the recipient. This is required if fax is not provided. Both fax and email can not be provided
email.x-conditionally-required-description: This is required if fax is not provided. Both fax and email can not be provided

fax.description: Fax of the recipient. In case of recipient set having more than one member, fax is not allowed
fax.x-conditionally-required-description: This is required if email is not provided. Both fax and email can not be provided. In case of recipient set having more than one member, fax is not allowed

securityOptions.description: Security options that apply to the recipient

sendThroughWebOptions.description: A JSON object of Type SendThroughWebOptions to customize the sendPage. This one will apply only if sendThroughWeb is set to true

fileUploadOptions.description: Controls various file upload options available on the send page

defaultValue.description: The default value of the field

mimeType.description: The mime type of the referenced file, used to determine if the file can be accepted and the necessary conversion steps can be performed

name.description: The original system file name of the document being sent - used to name attachments, and to infer the mime type if one is not explicitly specified

url.description: A publicly accessible URL for retrieving the raw file content. HTTP authentication is supported using standard embedded syntax - i.e. http://username:password@your.server.com/path/to/file

height.description: Height of the form field in pixels

left.description: No. of pixels from left of the page for form field placement

pageNumber.description: Number of the page where form field has to be placed, starting from 1

top.description: No. of pixels from bottom of the page for form field placement

width.description: Width of the form field in pixels

externalIdEnvelopes.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried

group.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried

id.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried

namespace.description: Only supported value for the ExternalID namespace at this time is API_OTHER

value.description: Value to compare the value of the whenField with, to evaluate the condition

whenFieldLocationIndex.description: Index of the location of the whenField whose value is the basis of the condition

whenFieldName.description: Name of the field whose value is the basis of condition

documentCreationInfoEnvelopes.description: Information about the document you want to send

callbackInfo.description: A publicly accessible url to which Adobe Sign will do an HTTP GET operation every time there is a new agreement event. HTTP authentication is supported using standard embedded syntax - i.e http://username:password@your.server.com/path/to/file. Adobe Sign can also ping your system using HTTP PUT with the final signed PDF. Please contact support@echosign.com if you wish to use this option

ccs.description: A list of one or more email addresses that you want to copy on this transaction. The email addresses will each receive an email at the beginning of the transaction and also when the final document is signed. The email addresses will also receive a copy of the document, attached as a PDF file

daysUntilSigningDeadline.description: The number of days that remain before the document expires. You cannot sign the document after it expires

externalId.description: A unique identifier for your transaction from an external system. You can use the ExternalID to search for your transaction through API

fileInfos.description: A list of one or more files (or references to files) that will be sent out for signature. If more than one file is provided, they will be combined into one PDF before being sent out. Note: Only one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified

formFieldLayerTemplates.description: Specifies the form field layer template or source of form fields to apply on the files in this transaction. If specified, the FileInfo for this parameter must refer to a form field layer template via libraryDocumentId or libraryDocumentName, or if specified via transientDocumentId or documentURL, it must be of a supported file type. Note: Only one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified

formFields.description: Information of form fields of an agreement. PDF_SIGNATURE inputType field is currently not supported

locale.description: The locale associated with this agreement - specifies the language for the signing page and emails, for example fr_FR.

mergeFieldInfo.description: The values will be presented to the signers for editable fields; for read-only fields the provided values will not be editable during the signing process. Merging data into fields is currently not supported when used with libraryDocumentId or libraryDocumentName. Only file and url are currently supported

message.description: An optional message to the recipients, describing what is being sent or why their signature is required

name.description: The name of the agreement that will be used to identify it, in emails and on the website

postSignOptions.description: URL and associated properties for the success page the user will be taken to after completing the signing process

recipientSetInfos.description: A list of one or more recipient sets. A recipient set may have one or more recipients. If any member of the recipient set signs, the agreement is considered signed by the recipient set. For regular (non-MegaSign) documents, there is no limit on the number of electronic signatures in a single document. Written signatures are limited to four per document. This limit includes the sender if the signature of the sender is also required
recipientSetInfos.x-conditionally-required-dsecription: If signatureFlow is set to SENDER_SIGNS_ONLY, this parameter is optional

reminderFrequency.description: Optional parameter that sets how often you want to send reminders to the recipients. The possible values are DAILY_UNTIL_SIGNED or WEEKLY_UNTIL_SIGNED

securityOptions.description: Sets optional secondary security parameters for your document

signatureFlow.description: Selects the workflow you would like to use - whether the sender needs to sign only, before the recipient, after the recipient, or not at all. The possible values for this variable are SENDER_SIGNATURE_NOT_REQUIRED, SENDER_SIGNS_LAST, SENDER_SIGNS_FIRST, SEQUENTIAL, PARALLEL or SENDER_SIGNS_ONLY. Note: leave unspecified for hybrid routing

signatureType.description: Specifies the type of signature you would like to request - written or e-signature

vaultingInfo.description: Sets the vaulting properties that allows Adobe Sign to securely store documents with a vault provider

redirectDelay.description: The delay (in seconds) before the user is taken to the success page. If this value is greater than 0, the user will first see the standard Adobe Sign success message, and then after a delay will be redirected to your success page.

redirectUrl.description: A publicly accessible url to which the user will be sent after successfully completing the signing process

externalPassword.description: The secondary password that will be used to protect signing the document for external signers. Note that Adobe Sign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties. This password is applied only if password protection is specified for external signers or all signers

internalPassword.description: The secondary password that will be used to protect signing the document for internal signers. Note that Adobe Sign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties. This password is applied only if password protection is specified for internal signers or all signers

kbaProtection.description: Signers need to pass Knowledge Based Authentication before they gain access to view and sign the document

openPassword.description: The secondary password that will be used to secure the PDF document. Note that Adobe Sign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties. This password is used only if protectOpen field is set to true

passwordProtection.description: Specifies if signers are required to enter a password to have access to sign the document

protectOpen.description: If set to true, the document is always be encrypted with this password every time it is sent by email. Recipients need to provide the password to be able to view the PDF files

webIdentityProtection.description: Specifies if signers are required to provide their web identity, before they gain access to view and sign the document

authenticationMethod.description: The authentication method for the recipients to have access to view and sign the document

password.description: The password required for the recipient to view and sign the document

phoneInfos.description: The phoneInfo required for the recipient to view and sign the document

documentCreationInfo.description: Information about the document you want to send

options.description: Options for authorising and sending the agreement

enabled.description: For accounts set up for document vaulting and the option to enable per agreement, this determines whether the document is to be vaulted

resources.description: Deletes an envelope/agreement. Agreement will no longer be visible in the user's Manage Page

parameters.description: Agreement Id

parameters.name: apiUser
parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

parameters.name: apiUser
parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Agreement Id

DeviceLocation.description: Location of the device that created the event (This value may be null due to limited privileges)

nextParticipantSetInfos.description: Information about who needs to act next for this document

nextParticipantSetMemberInfos.description: Information about the members of the next participant set

nextParticipantSetName.description: The name of the next participant set. Returned only, if the API caller is the sender of agreement

nextParticipantSetMemberInfos.description: Information about all the participant sets of this document

email.description: The email address of the next participant

name.description: The name of the next participant, if available

waitingSince.description: The date since which the document has been waiting for the participant to take action

participantSetMemberInfosEnvelopes.description: Information about all the participant sets of this document

alternateParticipants.description: All the child participants of the current participant. The possible values for the status of these participants are, SHARE and DELEGATE

company.description: The company of the participant, if available

email.description: The email address of the participant

name.description: The name of the participant, if available

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant

securityOptions.description: Security options that apply to the participant

title.description: The title of the participant, if available

externalId.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried

group.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried

id.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried

namespace.description: Only supported value for the ExternalID namespace at this time is API_OTHER

participantSetInfosEnvelopes.description: Information about all the participant sets of this document

participantSetId.description: The unique identifier of the participant set

participantSetMemberInfos.description: Information about the members of the recipient set

participantSetName.description: The name of the participant set. Returned only, if the API caller is the sender of agreement

privateMessage.description: Private message for the participants in the set

roles.description: The current roles of the participant set. A participant set can have one or more roles

securityOptions.description: Security options that apply to the participant

signingOrder.description: Index indicating sequential signing group (specified for hybrid routing)

status.description: The status of the participant set with respect to the document

agreementId.description: A resource identifier that can be used to uniquely identify the agreement resource in other apis

events.description: An ordered list of the events in the audit trail of this document

expiration.description: The date after nwhich the document can no longer be signed, if an expiration date is nconfigured. The value is nil if an expiration date is not set for the ndocument

externalId.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried

latestVersionId.description: An ID which uniquely identifies the current version of the document

locale.description: The locale associated with this agreement - for example, en_US

message.description: The message associated with the document that the sender has provided

modifiable.description: Information about whether the agreement can be modified

name.description: The name of the document, specified by the sender

nextParticipantSetInfos.description: Information about nwho needs to act next for this document - for example, if the agreement nis in status OUT_FOR_SIGNATURE or OUT_FOR_APPROVAL, this will be the nnext signer or approver. If the AgreementStatus is a terminal state, nthis array is empty

participantSetInfos.description: Information about all the participant sets of this document

securityOptions.description: Security information about the document that specifies whether or not a password is required to view and sign the document

signatureType.description: 'ESIGN : Agreement needs to be signed electronically n' or 'WRITTEN : Agreement will be signed using handwritten signature and signed document will be uploaded into the system n']: Specifies the type of signature you would like to request - written or e-signature. The possible values are ESIGN or WRITTEN

status.description: The current status of the document

vaultingEnabled.description: Whether vaulting was enabled for the agreement

DocumentHistoryEvents.description: An ordered list of the events in the audit trail of this document

actingUserEmail.description: Email address of the user that initiated the event

actingUserIpAddress.description: The IP address of the user that initiated the event

comment.description: The event comment. nFor RECALLED or REJECTED, the reason given by the user that initiates nthe event. For DELEGATE or SHARE, the message from the acting user to nthe participant

date.description: The date of the audit event

description.description: A description of the audit event

deviceLocation.description: Location of the device that created the event (This value may be null due to limited privileges)

participantEmail.description: Email address of the user that initiated the event

synchronizationId.description: A unique identifiern linking offline events to synchronization events (specified for offlinen signing events and synchronization events, else null

vaultEventId.description: The identifier assigned by the vault provider for the vault event (if vaulted, otherwise null)

versionId.description: An ID which uniquely identifies the version of the document associated with this audit event

parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Information about the widget that you want to create

parameters.name: apiUser

parameters.name: widgetId
parameters.description: ID of the widget

parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

resources.description: Gets a single combined PDF document for the documents associated with a widget

parameters.name: application/pdf
parameters.description: Accept Header

parameters.name: apiUser
parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

parameters.name: auditReport
parameters.description: When set to YES, attach an audit report to the signed Widget PDF. Default value is false

parameters.name: participantEmail
parameters.description: The email address of the participant to be used to retrieve documents

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: The version identifier of widget as provided by GET /widget/\{widgetId\}. If not provided then latest version will be used

parameters.name: widgetId
parameters.description: ID of the widget

resources.description: Retrieves workflows for a user

parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

resources.description: Retrieves workflows for a user

parameters.name: apiUser
parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The workflow identifier, as provided by GET /workflows

resources.description: Creates an agreement. Sends it out for signatures, and returns the agreementID in the response to the client

parameters.name: apiUser
parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Information about the agreement that you want to send and authoring options that you want to apply at the time of sending. NOTE: optional specified with the input parameters is a general guideline on normal request sent to this endpoint. You need to check the actual workflow definition to determine whether a parameter is required or optional

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The workflow identifier, as provided by GET /workflows
